required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lenalidomide Plus R-CHOP for CNS Relapse Prophylaxis in Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: Lenalidomide Plus R-CHOP for CNS Relapse Prophylaxis in Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

clinical_study.source: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, multicenter, phase 2 trial to explore the efficacy and safety of the combination of lenalidomide and R-CHOP for preventing the CNS relapse in the high-risk diffuse large B cell lymphoma.

primary_outcome.measure: The 2-year central nervous system relapse rates
primary_outcome.description: The 2-year central nervous system relapse rates

secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events were classified as defined by the National Cancer Institute Common Toxicity Criteria, version 2. Safety evaluations were focused especially on neurological symptoms and the development of deep venous thrombosis (DVT).

arm_group.description: Lenalidomide orally 25 mg per day was administered on days 1 through 10 of each cycle and delivered concomitantly with standard dose R-CHOP-21 regimen (rituximab 375 mg/m2, cyclophosphamide 750 mg/m2, doxorubicin 50 mg/m2 or Liposome doxorubicin 30mg/m2, vincristine 1.4 mg/m2 [capped at 2.0 mg], all on day 1; prednisone 100 mg per day on days 1 through 5). All patients received aspirin 100mg per day prophylaxis throughout, unless they were on therapeutic dose warfarin or low molecular weight heparin for intercurrent conditions. The treatment continued for a maximum of six to eight cycles or until disease progression. Tumor lysis prophylaxis, antiemetics, and supportive care were standard of care.

intervention.description: Lenalidomide orally 25 mg per day was administered on days 1 through 10 of each cycle and delivered concomitantly with standard dose R-CHOP-21 regimen (rituximab 375 mg/m2, cyclophosphamide 750 mg/m2, doxorubicin 50 mg/m2 or Liposome doxorubicin 30mg/m2, vincristine 1.4 mg/m2 [capped at 2.0 mg], all on day 1; prednisone 100 mg per day on days 1 through 5). All patients received aspirin 100mg per day prophylaxis throughout, unless they were on therapeutic dose warfarin or low molecular weight heparin for intercurrent conditions. The treatment continued for a maximum of six to eight cycles or until disease progression. Tumor lysis prophylaxis, antiemetics, and supportive care were standard of care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
age 18-72 years histologically confirmed DLBCL High risk for CNS recurrence: CNS-IPI:4-6 or involvement of testicular, kidneys or adrenal glands.
No pregnancy plans during treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
Evidence of CNS involvement, Transformed lymphoma, Primary mediastinal B-cell lymphoma EBV+DLBCL, Secondary malignancy, HIV positive, Creatinine > 2.0 mg/dl Intending to hematopoietic stem cell transplantation history of severe thrombus Pregnant or lactating women

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Hematology, Nanfang Hospital, Southern Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University
